title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 5011.3 - Insurance payable in the event of death
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 5011.3 - Insurance payable in the event of death

State Regulations

In the case of the death of a qualified member during the
effective period of insurance, the estate, or designated beneficiary or
beneficiaries, shall receive the benefits provided pursuant to section
512
of the

Education Law or section
448, 448-a, 508, 508-a, 606
or
606-a
of the Retirement and Social

Security Law, whichever is applicable, from the plan, as hereinafter provided. Nevertheless, the amount of insurance payable upon the death of a member, and
the eligibility to receive such payment, shall be determined in accordance with
the applicable provision of law as aforementioned. However, in no case shall
the amount of insurance payable by the plan upon the death of a member exceed
$50,000. In the event an amount in excess of $50,000 is payable to the estate, beneficiary or beneficiaries of a deceased member, the sum of $50,000 shall be
payable as group term life insurance as specified herein, and the excess over
$50,000 shall be paid as otherwise provided in the applicable provision of
law. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes
R. & Regs. Tit. 21
ยง
5011.3

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
